list_definition.definition: (soil which is full of) rotted leaves etc.
a growth on stale food etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This bread is covered with mould/mold.

list_definition.definition: a shape into which a substance in liquid form is poured so that it may take on that shape when it cools and hardens
something, especially a food, formed in a mould/mold.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The metal is moulded/molded into long bars.
He moulded/molded the clay into a ball.
She moulded/molded the figure out of/in clay.

list_ex_of_english: The aphid produces large quantities of honeydew which cover the foliage and provide an ideal substrate for the growth of sooty moulds.
It can cause the metal to tear away from the mould walls resulting in a deformed casting.
